abstract._value: The consumption of clean water is a basic human need and millions of plastic bottles end up in landfills or in oceans to be eaten by marine life then into the food chain and human beings. Ask Parliament to implement a legal duty for local councils to provide drinking fountains in towns and cities.

label._value: Local councils  to provide drinking fountains in towns and cities.

abstract._value: People with disabilities are the least represented group in parliament yet they are disproportionately adversely affected by Government policies and decisions.  We believe it is time this and future governments make every effort to ensure people with disabilities are fairly represented in Parliament

label._value: We call for a debate to discuss how more disabled people can be elected as MPs

abstract._value:
HMS Hermes served for over 30 years and was the flag ship during the Falklands conflict in 1982. She has been recently decommissioned by the indian navy and is now destined for the scrap yard.
She is a significant piece of the Royal Navy's history in the same class as HMS Victory and HMS Belfast.

label._value:
Save HMS Hermes.
Rescue her from the scrap yard and bring her home.

abstract._value: As a cat owner, I was shocked when my neighbour placed a row of over thirty rusty, three inch nails along the fence dividing our gardens. I rang the police, the council and the housing association to be told there was nothing i could do as he owns the fence. Both households have children and pets.

label._value: Make the use of inhumane cat deterrents a criminal offence

abstract._value:
The actor Sir Patrick Stewart has called for a "Peoples Vote" on Brexit.
Despite MPs who support a "Peoples Vote" withdrawing their amendment in Parliament recently, there are still some who want to hold another Referendum to try and overturn the democratic will of the people.

label._value: Say no to another EU Referendum aka "Peoples Vote"

abstract._value:
The General Dental Councils remit is to work for patients whilst working with dentists.
It is now time for the funding of this body to be reviewed and for it to be paid for out of general taxation.

label._value: Make General Dental Council (GDC) a tax-payer funded organisation.

abstract._value: 70% of NHS contracts awarded from April 2013 to April 2014 were to private companies, covering all aspects of the patient journey including diagnosis, treatment and on-going healthcare. As the Government were not elected on a manifesto of NHS privatisation this action is constitutionally non-viable.

label._value: The government has no mandate to privatise the NHS and should cease immediately.

abstract._value: Fast food delivery riders are under pressure to deliver as soon as possible, in some cases they have a set time, or lose money.  They can get on a moped with no training or experience.  All that is required is a provisional licence and a set of ‘l plates’.

label._value: Legislate to ban fast food delivery riders from working without a full license.

abstract._value: With allegations of Russian interference in elections in other countries and elements of the Leave campaign facing allegations of violating spending rules that may have influenced the narrow outcome of the referendum, citizens have a right to know if Brexit truly is the will of the British people.

label._value: Create an independent enquiry to determine if foreign powers influenced Brexit.

abstract._value: The current Conservative Government has just disallowed free parking across UK hospitals. Given the momentous strain upon those who provide care, they should be free of the burden of parking fees. Please reconsider repealing these fees to allow them to cope as they care for others.

label._value: Suspend the compulsory payment of parking fees for carers across UK hospitals.

abstract._value:
We the UK citizens who do not want to leave the EU want our voices heard. A referendum should be called on remaining or leaving the EU before Article 50 is triggered by the Government.
We believe that many people did not know what they were voting for on the 23rd June 2016.

label._value: Referendum before triggering article 50

abstract._value: Prohibition on marijuana in the UK has gone on for too long. For 88 years innocent civilians have had to break the law if they wanted to partake in a statistically less harmful substance than cigarettes or alcohol which kill over 100,000 people yearly. England has a chance to get ahead of the curve.

label._value: Make the production and sale of marijuana legal in UK

abstract._value: There are not enough education provisions for autistic young people aged 16+ within local areas. This is such a difficult transitional stage in their lives and many are forced to travel long distances in order to attend an appropriate provision that can meet their individual needs. This has to stop.

label._value: Make LA's provide Post 16 Autism specific education provision in the local area

abstract._value: The 2014 bill the bill makes it as inconvenient and unpleasant as possible to live in Britain without documents by privatising the process of checking status to people in civil society.

label._value: End the 'hostile environment' for immigration & revoke the 2014 immigration act

abstract._value: At the moment most companies comply with the set standards for disabled travellers. But this isn't enough, one wheelchair space per bus or train often leaves disabled people waiting at station because the designated spot is full. There need to be more than one space. The bare minimum isn't enough.

label._value: Change the standards for disabled travelling on all public transport.

abstract._value:
It has been reported that Ministers can use the Civil Service in support of a remain vote in the upcoming EU Referendum whilst banning support for those wishing to leave.

We believe it is very wrong to use the Civil Service and taxpayers money to support just one side of this campaign.

label._value: Stop using the Civil Service to support a remain vote in the EU referendum

abstract._value: Based on testimony from caregivers and survivors, Amnesty International estimates that more than 200 people may have died as a result of exposure to the chemical weapons agents, with many being children.The majority of survivors of the chemical weapons attacks have had no access to medical care.

label._value: Call on UK government to stop dealing immediately with Sudan Government

abstract._value: Leaders in the same localities are announcing different dates for the beginning and end of Ramadan and causing members in families to celebrate Eid on different dates.  Government must take over moon sighting and announce a single beginning and single end based on scientific and religious input.

label._value: Government should officially announce beginning and end of lunar calendar months

abstract._value:
People change their Banks, Gas/Electric suppliers daily and without any problems and without incurring any penalty. 
However as soon as you want to change you TV/Internet/Phone provider you get hit with projected costs of the service the provider may loose. This can’t be right. It’s very wrong

label._value: To Change ISP +TV leaving conditions it be in line with changing Banks/Gas/Elec

abstract._value: Special needs schools and PRU settings often need to use restraint procedures on children to ensure the safety of children and staff. During a restraint, my son has sustained 16 injuries on his face, neck, arms, legs, chest, abdomen and back. CCTV would ensure that incidents can be investigated.

label._value: Make it mandatory for there to be CCTV in special and PRU schools

abstract._value: Most of us recycle every item we can. I am frustrated with trying to buy food without plastic packaging. They charge 5p for a plastic carrier, introduce a national compulsory charge for supermarkets of 1p per plastic wrapped item. They will develop alternatives which will help reduce plastic waste.

label._value: Charge supermarkets 1p for every item sold in non recyclable plastic

abstract._value: If someone has more than one minor offence from over 10 years ago, they still appear on the DBS Disclosure and Barring Service. People are refused jobs as a result, even though there’s nothing serious on there. This means that they unfairly continue to suffer for stupid mistakes made when young.

label._value: Remove multiple minor convictions from DBS from over 10 years ago

abstract._value: The rules introduced in 2012 that child benefit should be capped at £60,000 are fundementally flawed. A single income of £60,000 means that you are not entitled to any child benefit yet 2 parents working can earn £98,000 and get the full entitlement.

label._value: Change Child Benefit cap from £60k sole earner to £100k joint or single income

abstract._value: Help us make the selling and cooking of live crustaceans (lobsters, crabs etc) illegal and get them included under the Animal Welfare Act 2006.

label._value: Get crustaceans included under the Animal Welfare Act 2006.

abstract._value: Sex offenders and online groomers are getting away with suspended sentences far too often and severely low custodial time. The sentences given need to increase to reflect the severity of these crimes which carry a life sentence for the victims.

label._value: Longer sentences for sex offenders

abstract._value: Make English more accessible for Deaf People (e.g. for us not to be forced to achieve English at C grade standard) each classes should have specialist tutor (e.g. Teacher of Deaf and being taught in small groups) Deaf people should not being stopped progressing from achieving a C grade or above

label._value: Stop forcing English Standard on Young Deaf children

abstract._value: Self-explanatory

label._value: Introduce PR to resolve the deep divisions created by the EU referendum.

abstract._value: Alpaca owners want the Government to work with them to eradicate bovine tuberculosis(btb). Testing rules are draconian and need to be reviewed. Please support a testing regime that does not condemn a healthy alpaca to death by always allowing a retest where no substantial evidence for disease exits.

label._value: Stop Government bTB tests being a death sentence on healthy animals.

abstract._value: Former Prime Minister David Cameron has overruled civil service advice so his special advisers get severance pay worth £282,000. This is contractually unnecessary and morally wrong at a time of public spending austerity. It smacks of cronyism and the money would be better spent on essential services

label._value: Limit government special advisor severance pay to the minimum contract amount

abstract._value: Theresa May is considering giving the ECJ a role in Britain once it has left the EU. She held talks on a referral system for European citizens who remain in the UK. Judges in the UK would refer cases to Luxembourg should queries crop up that have not been addressed during Britain's membership.

label._value: The Government MUST NOT let the ECJ override British justice after Brexit

abstract._value: In anticipation of the UK government's desire to replace the Human Rights act with a British Bill of Rights, it seems vital that every citizen have available to them a hard copy version of the new document thus insuring they can know, with complete transparency, exactly what their rights are.

label._value: One copy of the British Bill of Rights for every household.

abstract._value:
The Supreme Court judgment requires bus drivers do
more to make non-disabled people move from the wheelchair space if
needed by a disabled person, but many people still refuse. This prevents disabled people from travelling. Bus drivers are in an invidious position.

label._value: Use Buses Bill to make it mandatory for wheelchair space be vacated for a user

abstract._value: a lot of blood and tears was spilled building the cornerstones of what rights we enjoy today as humans, citizens and workers. Unfortunately a lot of young people miss out on this vital information and children should be educated about what rights they have so they are prepared for the real world

label._value: More citizen, human and working rights lessons into the educational curriculum

abstract._value: If a Parent, Grandparent, Guardian, Relative or Organisation that is stopping a child from seeing their biological parents or parents on their birth certificate, without a lawful reason (Child safety with formal proof) should be given a custodial sentence, like Brazil.

label._value: Make Parental Alienation a Criminal act that can carry a custodial sentence.

abstract._value: The authorities said that as soon as the bridge was paid for the fees would stop.

label._value: Stop Dartford toll fees.

abstract._value: Save our NHS and Keep it free.  Increase Personal Tax by a small amount  BUT make sure the tax raised is RING FENCED to be used ONLY for NHS and Healthcare purposes.

label._value: Increase taxes and ring-fence the income for the NHS

abstract._value: Child benefit should only be paid to children whilst they live and receive full time education in the UK

label._value: Restrict child benefit to children only residing in the UK

abstract._value: Women are BANNED from 'men-only' sessions at Luton's taxpayer-funded Olympic swimming pool 'for cultural reasons' and segregated in smaller community baths and segregated in smaller community baths.

label._value: Ban, male only,  gender segregated, activities in all UK  sports facilities.

abstract._value: Domestic abuse is a horrific situation for anyone to find themselves in & especially difficult for anyone who has to make decisions not just about their wellbeing but for children in their care. 2 women are killed weekly in the UK-if people feel they can leave safely this number may be reduced.

label._value: Improve the social welfare safety net for people fleeing domestic abuse
